item.title: Research
item.description: My goal is to demonstrate that deep learning systems, when interacting with other systems, are capable of much more than they can do today. I’ve worked (or working) on training neural networks to do fact-checking in knowledge base, solve reasoning tasks like mathematics, understand video more efficiently and optimize computation graph generated by compiler. Themes includes learning interleaving with searching. Here is the list of work that I’ve contributed to:

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a 4th-year student in École Polytechnique in France, enrolled in the “Cycle Ingénieur” Program. I am also a 2nd-year Master student in Shanghai Jiao Tong University as part of my double-degree program supervised by Ya Zhang. I am currently working as a research intern at Sea AI Lab in Singapore, under the guidance of Lin Min and Wang Yangzihao. I am working on a project that accelerates deep learning compiler (XLA) optimization and other interesting stuffs.
